channel.title: Machine Learning | Tomás E. Müller Bravo

item.title: DES 3YR sample analysis with PISCOLA
item.description:
Here I present the analisys of DES SNe with PISCOLA. The idea of this book is to show the whole process of working in a project and making the whole analysis as transparent as possible.

Press the tag below to see more examples

item.title: PISCOLA
item.description:
Python for Intelligent Supernova COsmology Light-curve Analysis (PISCOLA) is a code I have developed as part of my PhD to fit Type Ia supernova light curves in a data-driven way using Gaussian Process. The post analysis is done with Non-negative Matrix Factorization, a machine learning approach to extract features/parameters from the rest-frame light curves in order to do cosmology (Müller-Bravo et al., in prep.).

Press the tag below to see more examples
